The SPDE model with transparent barriers

Elias T Krainski

October-2024

Source: vignettes/transparent_barriers.Rmd
transparent_barriers.Rmd

The transparent barrier model

This model considers an SPDE over a domain Î©\Omega which is partitioned into kk subdomains Î©d\Omega_d, dâˆˆ{1,â€¦,k}d\in\{1,\ldots,k\}, where âˆªd=1kÎ©d=Î©\cup_{d=1}^k\Omega_d=\Omega. A common marginal variance is assumed but the range can be particular to each Î©d\Omega_d, rdr_d.

From Bakka et al. (2019), the precision matrix is ğ=1Ïƒ2ğ‘ğ‚Ìƒâˆ’1ğ‘ for ğ‘r=ğ‚+18âˆ‘d=1krd2ğ†d,ğ‚Ìƒr=Ï€2âˆ‘d=1krd2ğ‚Ìƒd \mathbf{Q} = \frac{1}{\sigma^2}\mathbf{R}\mathbf{\tilde{C}}^{-1}\mathbf{R} \textrm{ for } \mathbf{R}_r = \mathbf{C} + \frac{1}{8}\sum_{d=1}^kr_d^2\mathbf{G}_d , \;\;\; \mathbf{\tilde{C}}_r = \frac{\pi}{2}\sum_{d=1}^kr_d^2\mathbf{\tilde{C}}_d where Ïƒ2\sigma^2 is the marginal variance. (\mathbf{G}_d)_{i,j} = \langle 1_{\Omega_d} \nabla \psi_i, \nabla \psi_j \rangle = \int_{\Omega_d} \nabla \psi_i(\mathbf{s}) \nabla \psi_j(\mathbf{s}) \partial \mathbf{s}\; \textrm{ and }\; (\mathbf{\tilde{C}}_d)_{i,i} = \langle 1_{\Omega_d} \psi_i, 1 \rangle = \int_{\Omega_d} \psi_i(\mathbf{s}) \partial \mathbf{s} .

In the case when r=r1=r2=â€¦=rkr = r_1 = r_2 = \ldots = r_k we have ğ‘r=ğ‚+r28ğ†\mathbf{R}_r = \mathbf{C}+\frac{r^2}{8}\mathbf{G} and ğ‚Ìƒr=Ï€r22ğ‚Ìƒ\mathbf{\tilde{C}}_r = \frac{\pi r^2}{2}\mathbf{\tilde{C}} giving ğ=2Ï€Ïƒ2(1r2ğ‚ğ‚Ìƒâˆ’1ğ‚+18ğ‚ğ‚Ìƒâˆ’1ğ†+18ğ†ğ‚Ìƒâˆ’1ğ‚+r264ğ†ğ‚Ìƒâˆ’1ğ†) \mathbf{Q} = \frac{2}{\pi\sigma^2}( \frac{1}{r^2}\mathbf{C}\mathbf{\tilde{C}}^{-1}\mathbf{C} + \frac{1}{8}\mathbf{C}\mathbf{\tilde{C}}^{-1}\mathbf{G} + \frac{1}{8}\mathbf{G}\mathbf{\tilde{C}}^{-1}\mathbf{C} + \frac{r^2}{64}\mathbf{G}\mathbf{\tilde{C}}^{-1}\mathbf{G} ) which coincides with the stationary case in Lindgren and Rue (2015), when using ğ‚Ìƒ\tilde{\mathbf{C}} in place of ğ‚\mathbf{C}.

Implementation

In practice we define rdr_d as rd=pdrr_d = p_d r, for known p1,â€¦,pkp_1,\ldots,p_k constants. This gives ğ‚Ìƒr=Ï€r22âˆ‘d=1kpd2ğ‚Ìƒd=Ï€r22ğ‚Ìƒp1,â€¦,pk and 18âˆ‘d=1krd2ğ†d=r28âˆ‘d=1kpd2ğ†Ìƒd=r28ğ†Ìƒp1,â€¦,pk \mathbf{\tilde{C}}_r = \frac{\pi r^2}{2}\sum_{d=1}^kp_d^2\mathbf{\tilde{C}}_d = \frac{\pi r^2}{2} \mathbf{\tilde{C}}_{p_1,\ldots,p_k} \textrm{ and } \frac{1}{8}\sum_{d=1}^kr_d^2\mathbf{G}_d = \frac{r^2}{8}\sum_{d=1}^kp_d^2\mathbf{\tilde{G}}_d = \frac{r^2}{8}\mathbf{\tilde{G}}_{p_1,\ldots,p_k} where ğ‚Ìƒp1,â€¦,pk\mathbf{\tilde{C}}_{p_1,\ldots,p_k} and ğ†Ìƒp1,â€¦,pk\mathbf{\tilde{G}}_{p_1,\ldots,p_k} are pre-computed.
